sections.content: Drone content splits into cinematic aerials and FPV freestyle—different approaches, different gear. Both require understanding regulations, mastering flight skills, and capturing compelling footage. Here's what drone YouTubers need for professional aerial content.

sections.title: Drone Content Tips
content: Know and follow regulations (Part 107 in US)

faq.question: Do I need a drone license?
faq.answer: In US: Part 107 for commercial use. Recreational follows FAA rules. Under 250g (Mini series) has fewer requirements. Know your local regulations.

faq.question: Best beginner drone for YouTube?
faq.answer: DJI Mini 4 Pro—excellent quality, under 250g, no registration in US. Or DJI Air 3 for more features. Both have beginner-friendly flight modes.

faq.question: How to get smooth cinematic footage?
faq.answer: ND filters for 180° shutter rule. Slow stick movements. Tripod/Cine mode. Post-stabilization if needed. Plan shots before flying.

faq.question: FPV vs regular drone for content?
faq.answer: Different purposes. Cinematic drones for smooth, planned shots. FPV for dynamic, immersive footage. Many creators use both for variety.
